HEALTH EQUITY & DISPARITIES
IN A 21st CENTURY PANDEMIC
Call for Extended Abstracts: Differential Impacts of COVID-19 in NYS

The COVID-19 pandemic has exacerbated historical racial and ethnic health and social disparities in New York State. This edited book will present interdisciplinary essays and empirical studies focused on the nature and extent of the disparities; environmental, socioeconomic and occupational factors causing NYS’s racial and ethnic minority groups to be disproportionately impacted by COVID-19; and evaluations of interventions designed to mitigate harm and eliminate disparities. Submissions presenting recommendations drawn from current research and designed to inform future policy and practice toward building equity in health outcomes are encouraged.

Authors of accepted extended abstracts will be invited to participate in a virtual  Symposium during which they will present their work for input and comment by other symposium participants.  Complete chapters are due two months following the Symposium, at which point they will be peer reviewed through a peer review process. Due to the timely nature of the content, all accepted abstracts and draft and final chapters will be made available through an open access repository.  A preferred topics list is provided below. Please also consider emailing an editor if you want to check on the fit of your topic to the scope of the book.
